alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson; Lawrence; Randolph; Sharp (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 2:43AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Independence, Randolph, northeastern Jackson, Lawrence and southeastern Sharp Counties through 315 AM CST... At 243 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Annieville to Lynn to 8 miles south of Strawberry. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pocahontas... Walnut Ridge... Hoxie... Black Rock... Lake Charles State Park... Swifton... Imboden... Ravenden... Reyno... College City... Portia... Maynard... Biggers... Strawberry... Lynn... O`Kean... Alicia... Ravenden Springs... Minturn... Annieville... This includes US Highway 67 between mile markers 109 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CST for eastern and north central Arkansas.
